description: State of one-dimensional cellular automaton 'sigma' (Rule 150): 000,001,010,011,100,101,110,111 -> 0,1,1,0,1,0,0,1 at generation n, converted to a decimal number.
comments: Generation n (starting from the generation 0: 1) interpreted as a binary number, but written in base 10.Rows of the mod 2 trinomial triangle (A027907), interpreted as binary numbers: 1, 111, 10101, 1101011, ... (A118110) - _Jacob A. Siehler_, Aug 25 2006See A071053 for number of ON cells. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 28 2014
